The prices were reasonable for the quality and portions. Our total came out to about $66 with a card or $64 if you pay cash, which I think is a good deal for such a nice dinner for two.

Overall, I‚Äôm really happy I came here. The food, the service, and the whole atmosphere made this a wonderful first visit. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back again. Highly recommend it!

A Melodious Feast at Opera Cafe Lounge ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ

In the bustling enclave of Sheepshead Bay, where the hum of Emmons Avenue meets the gentle lapping of the bay‚Äôs waters, stands Opera Cafe Lounge‚Äîa Turkish-Mediterranean haven that orchestrates a dining experience as harmonious as its name suggests. The restaurant‚Äôs ambiance strikes a chord between casual comfort and refined elegance, inviting patrons to partake in a culinary symphony that resonates with authenticity and warmth.

The menu reads like a libretto of Turkish delights, each dish crafted with an evident reverence for tradition. The Grilled Salmon Shish emerges as a standout aria‚Äîa succulent fillet, marinated and grilled to perfection, embodying the delicate balance of flavors that Turkish cuisine champions. Equally compelling is the Fried Calf‚Äôs Liver, offering a textural juxtaposition of crisp exterior and tender interior, harmonized by the subtle sweetness of saut√©ed onions.

Service at Opera Cafe Lounge is attentive without being intrusive, a choreography of hospitality that enhances the dining experience. The staff‚Äôs knowledge of the menu and their genuine enthusiasm for the cuisine create an atmosphere where guests feel both valued and at ease.

However, even the most well-rehearsed performances have their occasional dissonant notes. Some patrons have observed inconsistencies in the execution of certain dishes, with reports of main courses occasionally lacking the vibrancy expected from such a reputable establishment.  Yet, these instances are rare and do little to overshadow the overall composition of quality and flavor that Opera Cafe Lounge consistently delivers.

In a city where dining options are as varied as the notes on a scale, Opera Cafe Lounge distinguishes itself by staying true to its roots while embracing the cosmopolitan palate of Brooklyn. It‚Äôs a place where the rich tapestry of Turkish-Mediterranean cuisine is celebrated with each dish, leaving diners with a lingering melody of satisfaction.

*Update* on my most recent visit I was seated with a waiter that rushed the entire meal and experience to a terrible extent.  We ordered 5 appetizers and 3 dinners and in 10 minutes all of these items were placed on our table! We were not able to pace and enjoy what should have been the best parts of the meal.  The waiter also did not check in with us at any point while we were eating, and walked by when I tried to call him over.  We had to stop a busser eventually because we never received our drinks.

When the waiter came by to ask if we were done I did let him know that we were also missing one of the apps.  It is also likely that he was rushing us to get the bill paid and his tip before going home as we saw him leave right after that!

I would give the service 1 star based on his work BUT the waitress that came after him (Oyku) was excellent! She cleared away the pile of plates he had left on my table, brought us water, we shared another appetizer while talking and even stayed for coffee and dessert.

I was ready to leave and never return, but the night ended decently.  If I am ever seated in his section however.. I will be moving.
